elements.title: The Rose Garden of Love (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nusrati attributes the virtues of a good ruler to his patron Ali Adil Shah II in The Rose Garden of Love (manuscript scene pictured)?

elements.title: a Twitter account (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Twitter account became a major source on what was happening during the 2022 COVID-19 protests in China?

elements.title: Jim Hobbins (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jim Hobbins played two years of professional football, spaced apart by 11 years?

elements.title: Ḥassan Pasha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Baghdad governor Ḥassan Pasha bought the slave who married his granddaughter and went on to become governor of the same city?

elements.title: M. Khalid Roashan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that University of Nebraska alumnus M. Khalid Roashan helped draft the 1964 Constitution of Afghanistan?

elements.title: The Neanderthals Rediscovered (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the authors of The Neanderthals Rediscovered learned that their book proposal had been accepted on the same day they took their twin sons home from hospital?

elements.title: Władysław Umiński (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Władysław Umiński has been called the "Polish Jules Verne"?

elements.title: Alex Laferriere (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that current NHL player Alex Laferriere refused to try out ice skating at a young age, and only did so when bribed with Skittles?
